contentrichtext.text: '''Yhprum's Law''' is the opposite of [[Murphy's Law]] (Yhprum = Murphy backwards). The simple formula of Yhprum's Law is: "Everything, that can work, will work." Another formulation of the law due to [[Richard Zeckhauser]], a professor for [[political economy]] at [[Harvard University]] states: "Sometimes systems that should not work, work nevertheless." Resnick ''et al''. (2006) used this law to describe how intensive and seemingly [[altruistic]] participation by giving ranking is observed in the [[eBay]] system.<ref name=Resnick06>{{cite journal|last=Resnick|first=Paul|coauthors=Zeckhauser, Richard; Swanson, John; Lockwood, Kate|title=The value of reputation on eBay: A controlled experiment|journal=Experimental Economics|year=2006|month=June|volume=9|issue=2|pages=79â€“101|doi=10.1007/s10683-006-4309-2|url=http://ksghome.harvard.edu/~RZeckhauser/postcards.pdf}}</ref> == References== {{Reflist}} [[Category:Sociological theories]] {{sociology-stub}}
